column4: hello. I'm using ubuntu dapper drake. I'm having some trouble with gaim. I accidentally messed up all of the icons while trying to install a theme. I tried re-installing, not sure if I did it right, and it didn't fix the problem. I either need to get my gaim icons back or to upgrade to the newest version.

hello. I'm using ubuntu dapper drake. I'm having some trouble with gaim. I accidentally messed up all of the icons while trying to install a theme. I tried re-installing, not sure if I did it right, and it didn't fix the problem. I either need to get my gaim icons back or to upgrade to the newest version. how would I reinstall the icons for gaim or where is the installer for 2.0.0beta6?
I can only find gaim beta 6 in edgy repositories
how can I re-install gaim 2.0.0beta3?
what is the problem with it?
was this theme installed as root or not
I'm not sure, I'm new to linux. I have the link to the theme, am I allowed to post links in here?
yeah you are, just try sudo apt-get remove --purge gaim and then sudo apt-get install gaim
will that destroy account data like chat logs and my accounts?
could, you can back them up with mv ~/.gaim ~/.gaim.backup
am I allowed to post code in here? Perhaps if I show you what I did it would prevent having to re-install.
you can post it so long as it isn't really long
sudo mv /usr/share/pixmaps/gaim /usr/share/pixmaps/gaim_backup
you did that?
ok sudo mv -f /usr/share/pixmaps/gaim_backup /usr/share/pixmaps/gaim
that should fix it
thanks again for the help. another question if you don't mind. I'm having trouble with java. for some reason it takes up a massive amount of my cpu but not when I'm on my windows hard drive.
massive amount of resources is what java is all about
on windows, the java applet in question, only takes up 40% of my cpu. On ubuntu it takes up 100% and still barely functions.
don't know
could it be that I have the wrong java? I have sun java 5.0 runtime with firefox plugin.
java 6 is out but I doubt it is going to have too much of a boost
thanks anyway.
